perturbation.original_text: For purposes of this Agreement, the term "Intellectual Property Rights" means know-how, inventions, patents, patent rights, and registrations and applications, renewals, continuations and extensions thereof, works of authorship and art, copyrightable materials and copyrights (including, but not limited to, titles, computer code, designs, themes, objects, characters, character names, stories, dialog, catch phrases, concepts, artwork, animation, sounds, musical compositions, graphics and visual elements, audio-visual effects and methods of operation, and any related documentation), copyright registrations and applications, renewals and extensions thereof, mask works, industrial rights, trademarks, service marks, trade names, logos, trademark registrations and applications, renewals and extensions thereof, trade secrets, rights in trade dress and packaging, publicity, personality and privacy rights, rights of attribution, paternity, integrity and other similarly afforded "moral" rights, and all other forms of intellectual property and proprietary rights recognized by the U.S. laws, and other applicable foreign and international laws, treaties and conventions.
perturbation.changed_text: For purposes of this Agreement, the term "Intellectual Property Rights" means tangible personal property, including but not limited to, physical prototypes, models, and marketing materials. This definition specifically excludes all intangible rights such as patents, copyrights, trademarks, and trade secrets, regardless of their recognition under U.S. or international laws.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition aligns with standard legal definitions of Intellectual Property Rights. The modified definition restricts intellectual property to tangible personal property, explicitly excluding intangible rights. This contradicts established intellectual property law, creating ambiguity about the protection of intangible assets crucial to the agreement's subject matter.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Copyright Act, United States Patent Act, Lanham Act

perturbation.original_text: Licensee owns and shall retain all right, title, and interest in and to (i) all software source code, tools, and technical documentation used by or for Licensee to create the Wireless Products, including without limitation any and all software code included in the Wireless Products, (ii) all aspects and elements of the Wireless Products other than the Fox Intellectual Property therein, including without limitation any and all gaming engines, game concepts, rules, scripts, and other Intellectual Property Rights therein; and (iii) any and all Intellectual Property Rights in any of the foregoing (the "Licensee Materials").
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee owns and shall retain all right, title, and interest in and to (i) all software source code, tools, and technical documentation used by or for Licensee to create the Wireless Products, including without limitation any and all software code included in the Wireless Products, (ii) all aspects and elements of the Wireless Products other than the Fox Intellectual Property therein, including without limitation any and all gaming engines, game concepts, rules, scripts, and other Intellectual Property Rights therein; and (iii) any physical manifestations or tangible results of the foregoing (the "Licensee Materials").
perturbation.explanation: The change from "Intellectual Property Rights" to "physical manifestations or tangible results" in defining Licensee Materials creates a conflict. The original text correctly acknowledges Licensee's ownership of IP rights. The modified text restricts ownership to only tangible outcomes, undermining the protection of Licensee's intangible IP assets.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Copyright Act, United States Patent Act, Lanham Act

perturbation.original_text: Licensee hereby does expressly assign to Fox any and all rights of paternity or integrity, rights to claim authorship, to object to any distortion, mutilation or other modification of, or other derogatory actions in relation to the PSM, the Fox Intellectual Property, and any of Fox's Intellectual Property Rights in and to the PSM and or the Fox Intellectual Property and any derivative works thereof, whether or not such would be prejudicial to Fox's honor or reputation, and any similar right, existing under judicial or statutory law of any country in the world, or under any treaty ("Moral Rights"), regardless of whether such right is denominated or generally referred to as a moral right. Licensee hereby does irrevocably transfer and assign to Fox any and all Moral Rights that Licensee may have in Fox's Intellectual Property Rights in and to the PSM and the Fox Intellectual Property and any derivative works thereof and shall cause Licensee's employees and contractors, including Licensee's developers of the Wireless Products, to do likewise. Licensee hereby does forever waive and agree never to assert any and all Moral Rights it may have in Fox's Intellectual Property Rights in and to the PSM and the Fox Intellectual Property and any derivative works thereof and shall cause its employees and contractors (including the developers) to do likewise.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensee hereby does expressly permit Fox to suggest the Wireless product or any products developed from the PSM can be used by any brand of Fox's choice with no limits, regardless of the product's theme. The Licensee further does irrevocably accept the financial offers given to it by Fox's marketing strategies and shall cause Licensee's employees and contractors, including Licensee's developers of the Wireless Products, to do likewise. Licensee hereby does forever support any marketing done with Fox's Intellectual Property Rights, regardless of quality and shall cause its employees and contractors (including the developers) to do likewise.
perturbation.explanation: This paragraph originally dealt with "Moral Rights", which protect the author's reputation. The modification changes this into a clause where the licensor can partner with any brand, which is in contradiction of this law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Copyright Act, Visual Artists Rights Act (VARA)
